intro: Oreocharis flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green oreocharis, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-green foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
